body.body: The numbers in brackets in the following text refer to the exploded view
Remove the output shaft bearing sleeve (1), needle roller bearing (2) and hardened thrust washer (3).
Mark one side of first gear (4) to denote its correct orientation. Remove first gear (4) from the output shaft (19).
Remove the first gear bearing (5) and the thrust washer (6).
Slide fifth gear (7) from the output shaft (19).
Remove the circlip (8) from in front of the fourth gear (10).
Remove the splined thrust washer (9) from the output shaft (19).
Slide third gear (11) off the output shaft (19) and remove the splined bush (12) and thrust washer (13).
Remove the circlip (14) from in front of sixth gear (15).
Remove sixth gear (15) from the output shaft (19).
Remove the circlip (16) from in front of second gear (18).
Remove thrust washer (17) and slide off second gear (18).

Position the output shaft (19) in a vice with soft jaws fitted. Tighten the vice to prevent the shaft from turning and release the lock tab (21) from the output sprocket nut (20), then release the nut.
Remove the transmission sprocket nut (20), locktab (21) and sprocket (22).
Collect the oil seal (24) and retaining ring (23).

If it is necessary to replace the large bearing (25) at the end of the shaft, use a suitable tool to support both the bearing and output shaft sprocket sleeve (26). Protect the output shaft thread with a thread protector or similar and press the shaft through the bearing and shaft sprocket sleeve.

When removing the output shaft bearing, always wear overalls, eye, face and hand protection. The bearing races are hardened and are liable to splinter if broken. Debris from broken bearings could cause injury to eyes, face and any unprotected parts of the body.

search: Output Shaft - Disassembly
The numbers in brackets in the following text refer to the exploded view
Exploded View – Output Shaft
Remove the output shaft bearing sleeve (1), needle roller bearing (2) and hardened thrust washer (3).
Mark one side of first gear (4) to denote its correct orientation. Remove first gear (4) from the output shaft (19).
Remove the first gear bearing (5) and the thrust washer (6).
Slide fifth gear (7) from the output shaft (19).
Remove the circlip (8) from in front of the fourth gear (10).
Remove the splined thrust washer (9) from the output shaft (19).
Remove the fourth gear (10).
Slide third gear (11) off the output shaft (19) and remove the splined bush (12) and thrust washer (13).
Remove the circlip (14) from in front of sixth gear (15).
Remove sixth gear (15) from the output shaft (19).
Remove the circlip (16) from in front of second gear (18).
Remove thrust washer (17) and slide off second gear (18).

Position the output shaft (19) in a vice with soft jaws fitted. Tighten the vice to prevent the shaft from turning and release the lock tab (21) from the output sprocket nut (20), then release the nut.
Remove the transmission sprocket nut (20), locktab (21) and sprocket (22).
Collect the oil seal (24) and retaining ring (23).

If it is necessary to replace the large bearing (25) at the end of the shaft, use a suitable tool to support both the bearing and output shaft sprocket sleeve (26). Protect the output shaft thread with a thread protector or similar and press the shaft through the bearing and shaft sprocket sleeve.

When removing the output shaft bearing, always wear overalls, eye, face and hand protection. The bearing races are hardened and are liable to splinter if broken. Debris from broken bearings could cause injury to eyes, face and any unprotected parts of the body.
title: Output Shaft - Disassembly
